Here at Black Cell Security we specialize in providing network security services such as penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and Wi-Fi assessments. We can also provide services such as open-source PBX installation, configuration, and hardening the PBX platform.

Our team is comprised of certified ethical hackers who have worked for major telecoms, US Navy, US Air force, and as DoD contractors providing security for large networks.

We can also provide computer forensic services on various platforms. Whether your preparing for a major audit or wanting to test a new solution before deployment we can help you identify your risks and help you plan your remediation. Feel free to contact us regarding the services we provide and to plan your next assessment.

   EMAIL:
 
 

We provide a variety of services that enable businesses and institutions to get a good look at how secure their networks really are and to help bring security into focus. These services include:
Penetration Testing:
 
Black box testing assumes no prior knowledge of network to be tested. With this form of testing Black Cell Security will do web recon to discover information such as IP's, emails, infrastructure, and other network data. This type of test will show you what a hacker can gain without prior knowledge of your network.

White Box testing refers to the disclosure of information such as infrastructure to be tested including IP ranges.
 
 
Network Vulnerability Assessment:
 
An internal look at your network to identify security holes and assist in increasing the internal network security posture. This type of test is conducted on site and all network information will be needed in advance to plan the engagement.
 
Wi-Fi Security Assessment:
 
Like a vulnerability assessment this test is conducted on site and is used to identify your overall security posture of your Wi-Fi segments. We will scan the site, check for weak levels of encryption and identify rogue access points.
 
Open Source PBX Deployment and Security:
 
Black Cell Security also provides open source PBX installation using Asterisk and Trixbox to support your telephony needs. With the PBX deployment we also harden the deployment to mitigate possible security risks. The open source PBX platform supports multiple lines, IVR, Voicemail, Music on Hold, and other features. The platforms support most IP phones and analog to digital conversion.

07 Nov 2006

Attackers end-run around IE security Robert Lemos, 2006-11-07 indepth Microsoft shored up the security of its flagship browser with the latest release, but the software still lets through attacks on ActiveX flaws in other components of Windows..

08 Nov 2006

Microsoft trains partners to improve security News Brief, 2006-11-08 The software giant will put its OEMs through two-and-a-half days of training on its secure software development practices as the company prepares to ship Windows Vista.

07 Nov 2006

Wikipedia targeted by virus writer News Brief, 2006-11-07 Online fraudsters slipped a virus into the German edition of the Internet encyclopedia to use as an infection point for a phishing campaign, says an antivirus firm.
